DOCNAME: CASE OF VAN DE HURK v. THE NETHERLANDS
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (independent tribunal);No violation of Art. 6-1 (fair trial);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant is a GPE national born in DATE . He lives at GPE in the province of GPE - Brabant , where he is a dairy farmer .

PERSON on FAC ( PERSON ) of DATE , ORG ) CARDINAL -"the DATE Ordinance"- was published on DATE , the applicant was allocated a reference quantity ( that is a quantity of milk in excess of which an additional levy is payable - see paragraph CARDINAL below ) of QUANTITY .

ORG In addition , by a letter which reached the registry of the ORG on DATE , PERSON applied to the President of the ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) for an interim measure to the effect that , pending the ORG ’s judgment , he should not be required to pay the additional levy for DATE and the following milk DATE and that he should be paid back the additional levy he had already paid in respect of milk production which had not exceeded the reference quantity claimed on the basis of CARDINAL new stands .

He argued firstly that the Minister was estopped from using this argument , which had never been invoked as a reason for rejecting the applicant ’s original claim ; in the alternative , the Minister ’s calculations were wrong . ORG On DATE the President of the ORG gave a decision refusing the interim measure requested , holding that it was not prima facie likely that the ORG itself would overturn the Minister ’s decision . In his view , the Minister had not erred in rejecting the applicant ’s claim . The President did not find it necessary to address the question of the increase in the number of stands for milch cows and cows in calf , since he accepted the Minister ’s alternative argument concerning the applicant ’s investment . He rejected the applicant ’s submission that the Minister was estopped from relying on that ground , holding that section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW ( LANGUAGE administratieve rechtspraak bedrijfsorganisatie , PERSON ( Official Bulletin ) DATE , CARDINAL , as amended - " LAW " ) entitled him to supplement his arguments while the applicant had not only had sufficient possibility of replying to the Minister ’s alternative submission but had in fact done so . Commenting on the President ’s decision , he discussed extensively his own method of calculation . Like the Minister , he took as his starting - point the investment involved in building the new shed for heifers . Starting from the figure which he gave before the President - NLG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) - he calculated a price per square QUANTITY of NLG CARDINAL . In the alternative , if the Minister ’s calculations were to be followed , he submitted that the Minister had based them on incorrect LOC ; if applied correctly , the Minister ’s method resulted in a figure referable to the extension of stands for milch cows and cows in calf of NLG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , which was sufficient since the applicant had carried out the physical work involved in building the new cowshed himself ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The Minister filed a written statement in reply on DATE . A public hearing was held on DATE , during which the applicant again contested the Minister ’s method of calculation and argued that , should the ORG accept it nevertheless , the price per square metre calculated by the Minister was in any case too low ; it was not NLG CARDINAL - the Minister ’s figure - but NLG CARDINAL .

Adopting the same approach as the President , it did not decide whether the increase in the number of cow stands had been sufficient ; indeed , it explicitly declined to address this point . It likewise accepted the Minister ’s method of calculation ; applying it to the figures submitted by the applicant in response to the decision of its President ( a price per square QUANTITY of NLG CARDINAL , the new stands covering a surface of QUANTITY ) , the ORG arrived at an investment of NLG CARDINAL referable to the increase in the number of stands . " The applicant ’s statement first made at the hearing to the effect that the price per square metre is in reality NLG CARDINAL.CARDINAL will not be taken into account in reviewing the decision appealed against , in view of the rule laid down in LAW para . CARDINAL of the LAW , amongst other things . "
Accordingly , concluding that the applicant ’s investments fell short of the minimum required , the ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . ORG There had been surpluses of milk and milk products for some considerable time . By DATE , according to the preamble of ORG ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , " quantities of milk delivered [ were ] increasing at a rate such that disposal of surpluses [ was ] imposing financial burdens and market difficulties which [ jeopardised ] the very future of the common agricultural policy " .

CARDINAL . ORG Amending an earlier regulation which had not proved sufficiently effective , ORG ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( ORG ( ORG ) no . L CARDINAL of DATE , p. CARDINAL ) was adopted by ORG in response to these structural surpluses .

ORG The Council of ORG decided that for an initial period of DATE the quantity of milk every dairy farmer would be allowed to produce should be limited to a fixed amount ( the " reference quantity " ) . To this end they introduced a system under which dairy farmers had to pay a penalty or " additional levy " on milk delivered in excess of their allotted quantities . It was left to the GPE themselves to share out their guaranteed quantities within their jurisdictions according to a formula prescribed by ORG ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( ORG no . L CARDINAL of DATE , p. CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL were binding in their entirety and directly applicable in all member ORG . They entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW paras . CARDINAL of LAW ( Landbouwwet ) , the Minister of Agriculture , ORG and ORG ( minister voor landbouw , natuurbeheer en visserij ) is empowered to issue an ordinance ( beschikking ) imposing a levy on the production , supply and processing of agricultural produce . Such an ordinance may be adopted , inter alia , to give effect to regulations , guidelines , decisions and recommendations of the ORG in so far as they relate to its common agricultural policy .

CARDINAL . Council Regulations ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL were implemented by the DATE Ordinance . This Ordinance was given retroactive effect to DATE , that being the date of entry into force of LAW .

ORG Dairy farmers who had assumed obligations in connection with investments ( investeringsverplichtingen ) after DATE but before CARDINAL DATE could claim a larger reference quantity , calculated according to a formula given in the DATE Ordinance , if certain conditions were fulfilled . ORG A person claiming an increased reference quantity on the basis of LAW DATE Ordinance had until DATE to file his claim with the Head of ORG , who would forward it to the provincial Director of ORG ( Articles CARDINAL para . CARDINAL , CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the DATE Ordinance ) . The Director gave a decision after consulting an advisory panel .

" A claim as referred to in the first paragraph shall be reasoned . It shall include a statement supported by evidence as to the various grounds of the claim referred to in LAW , ORG , ORG , CARDINAL and CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . ORG An appeal against the decision of the Minister lay within DATE to the ORG ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The ORG is a judicial body set up under LAW . It was instituted initially to hear appeals against decisions and acts by various economic regulatory bodies , but gradually its jurisdiction has been extended to include certain decisions of central government and other independent government bodies under specialist legislation . According to LAW for making provision for appeals to ORG " ( PERSON voor het openstellen van beroep op het ORG van Beroep voor het GPE ) of CARDINAL DATE , Government Gazette DATE , CARDINAL , the ORG should in principle be the competent court with regard to " legislation of a socio - economic nature " .

Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act gave the ORG competence to review such acts and decisions for compliance with legislation of a general nature and general principles of good governance ( algemene beginselen van behoorlijk bestuur ) , to check whether there had been any abuse of authority and to determine whether in weighing up the interests at stake , the government body concerned had acted reasonably in deciding as it had .

CARDINAL . ORG The judges of the ORG are appointed for life by the ORG . They must have the same qualifications as ORG judges ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) . They take the same oath and receive the same salary as ORG judges and are subject to the same rules and procedure as regards supervision and dismissal ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ) .

Tribunal judges may not have any other official position , nor may they hold any position in private enterprise or in any association of employers or employees ( section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The proceedings before the ORG are public . At the material time , they normally comprised written proceedings ( an application filed by an appellant , a memorial in reply submitted by the government body concerned , and possibly - if the President consented - additional memorials ) followed by an oral hearing ( sections CARDINAL et seq . of LAW ) .

Section CARDINAL allowed both the government body and the applicant to " alter their claim or their defence and the grounds advanced in support , until the close of the hearing , unless the ORG [ was ] of the opinion that such a change ORG ] the opponent at an unreasonable disadvantage " .

CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW of the CARDINAL LAW the applicant could apply for interim measures to the President of the ORG . He could do so both before and after filing an appeal on the merits . The President would give a decision as soon as possible , having heard the government body concerned or at least offered it the opportunity to be heard .

CARDINAL . ORG The ORG , against whose judgment there was no further appeal , was empowered to overrule the decision appealed against and to provide for the consequences of such reversal ; in particular , it could order the government body concerned to make , retract or alter a decision or to act or refrain from acting in a certain way . The judgment might include an order to pay a penalty in the event of non - compliance ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) . The ORG could also order the body to pay compensation for any damage suffered by the appellant as a result of the decision or act appealed against ( section CARDINAL ) . To the extent that the judgment ordered payment of a sum of money , it could be executed in accordance with the rules pertaining to the execution of judgments of the courts in civil cases ( section CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Sections DATE and CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act provided as follows :

" CARDINAL . ORG If in Our opinion the consequences of a judgment [ i.e. of ORG ] are contrary to the general interest , We may , on the recommendation of those of Our ministers whom it concerns , decide that it shall not be followed or shall not be followed in its entirety .

CARDINAL . Pending the taking of a decision under the preceding paragraph , We may , on the recommendation of those of Our ministers whom it concerns , suspend the judgment in whole or in part for a length of time to be determined by Us . Even after prolongation , suspension may not be for DATE .

ORG A decision as referred to in the first paragraph may only be taken within DATE of the judgment or , if the judgment is suspended within that period , within the length of time determined for the suspension . A decision as referred to in the second paragraph may only be taken within DATE of the judgment .
CARDINAL . ORG Our decisions shall be published in the Official Bulletin .
CARDINAL . ORG The first CARDINAL paragraphs shall not apply in so far as the decision awards compensation or partial compensation or orders the payment of costs .

ORG If We decide that the judgment shall not be followed or shall not be followed in its entirety , ORG may , at the request of the person concerned , retry the case taking due notice of Our Decision or order the government body concerned to pay compensation for all or part of the damage suffered by the appellant as a consequence of the fact that the judgment is not followed or not followed in its entirety .
DATE . ... "

The expressions " We " , " Our " and " Us " in the above sections referred to the fact that the decisions under LAW took the form of a royal decree ( PERSON besluit ) , that is a decree signed by the ORG and the Minister responsible . Since such a decree can only be adopted on the initiative and the ( political ) responsibility of a Minister , it was effectively the Minister who had the power to issue a decision under section CARDINAL paras . CARDINAL . Following customary GPE terminology , the present judgment will refer to the ORG and the Minister together as " the Crown " .

CARDINAL . No use was ever made of the powers under sections DATE and CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act . The above - mentioned Guidelines ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) stated explicitly that new laws conferring jurisdiction on the ORG should declare the LAW applicable except for sections CARDINAL . Before the Guidelines were drawn up , the Minister of ORG replied as follows to a question from ORG ( PERSON ) :

" In my opinion , it is in principle never necessary to declare sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL applicable by analogy . At the time , these CARDINAL provisions were included in the LAW as a matter of prudence , which may be explained by the circumstance that DATE the legislature had little idea of the way in which administrative judicial procedure would develop . No use has ever been made of the ORG ’s powers under LAW . One might even venture to suggest that the scheme of sections CARDINAL DATE has become a dead letter . " ( GPE ( Parliamentary Documents ) II DATE , DATE , A - C , p. CARDINAL )
CARDINAL . ORG The CARDINAL Act remained in force until DATE . On DATE a General Administrative Code ( PERSON ) came into force , laying down new uniform rules of administrative - law procedure .

At the same time LAW was replaced by ORG ( GPE bestuursrechtspraak bedrijfsorganisatie ) . Under section CARDINAL of that Act , the new uniform rules laid down in LAW also govern the procedure of the ORG .
There is no provision in either the LAW or the LAW empowering any executive authority to interfere with the binding force of a judgment .
